docs.snippet: LEAD: The United States is expected to be named as the site for the 1994 World Cup in an announcement today. Below is some interesting information about the tournament.

docs.snippet: LEAD: His first dream was to get Pele to play for his team and help establish soccer in the United States, but his other dream was the ultimate one.

headline.main: World Cup; U.S. Soccer Hopes Renewed

docs.snippet: LEAD: HOUSING abandonment, once the scourge of New York City neighborhoods, has declined sharply over the last few years. Even so, city officials are preparing to assume ownership of a few thousand more parcels of real estate on which owners have...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: HOUSING abandonment, once the scourge of New York City neighborhoods, has declined sharply over the last few years. Even so, city officials are preparing to assume ownership of a few thousand more parcels of real estate on which owners have fallen behind in their property taxes.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Cairns Group of 14 farming nations today called for fundamental trade reform by phasing out agricultural subsidies worldwide by the year 2000, starting with a freeze at the end of this year.

docs.snippet: LEAD: State Department officials said today that they hoped to send more diplomats to Nicaragua as soon as possible to show continued support for the political opponents of the Sandinista Government.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Tennis Potter Upsets Shriver: Third-seeded Barbara Potter upset top-seeded Pam Shriver, 7-6, 7-6, yesterday in the semifinals of the $200,000 Virginia Slims of Newport, R.I. Potter of Woodbury, Conn., ranked No. 16 in the world, faces second-seeded Lori McNeil of Houston in the final today.
